1.name: Sweet Charity
1.description: Taxi dancer Charity continues to have Faith in the human race despite apparently endless disappointments at its hands, and Hope that she will finally meet the nice young man to romance her ...                See full summary »

2.name: Easy Rider
2.description: Through the open country and desert lands, two bikers head from L.A to New Orleans, and along the way, meet a man who bridges a counter-culture gap they are unaware of.

3.name: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
3.description: Wyoming, early 1900s. Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid are the leaders of a band of outlaws. After a train robbery goes wrong they find themselves on the run with a posse hard on their heels. Their solution - escape to Bolivia.

4.name: On Her Majesty's Secret Service
4.description: James Bond woos a mob boss' daughter and goes undercover to uncover the true reason for Blofeld's allergy research in the Swiss Alps that involves beautiful women from around the world.

5.name: Midnight Cowboy
5.description: A naive hustler travels from Texas to New York City to seek personal fortune, finding a new friend in the process.

6.name: More
6.description: Stefan, a recent college graduate, hitchhikes from Germany to Paris where he meets American expatriate, Estelle. They chase the sun to Ibiza. An idyllic island life degenerates when she introduces him to heroin and they get addicted.

7.name: True Grit
7.description: A drunken, hard-nosed U.S. Marshal and a Texas Ranger help a stubborn teenager track down her father's murderer in Indian territory.

8.name: The Italian Job
8.description: Comic caper movie about a plan to steal a gold shipment from the streets of Turin by creating a traffic jam.

9.name: The Wild Bunch
9.description: An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the "traditional" American West is disappearing around them.

10.name: Battle of Britain
10.description: In 1940, the British Royal Air Force fights a desperate battle to prevent the Luftwaffe from gaining air superiority over the English Channel as a prelude to a possible Axis invasion of the U.K.

11.name: Paint Your Wagon
11.description: Two unlikely prospector partners share the same wife in a California gold rush mining town.

12.name: Fellini - Satyricon
12.description: A series of disjointed mythical tales set in first century Rome.

13.name: Hello, Dolly!
13.description: Matchmaker Dolly Levi travels to Yonkers to find a partner for "half-a-millionaire" Horace Vandergelder, convincing his niece, his niece's intended, and his two clerks to travel to New York City along the way.

14.name: Support Your Local Sheriff!
14.description: In the old west, a man becomes a Sheriff just for the pay, figuring he can decamp if things get tough. In the end, he uses ingenuity instead.

15.name: The Bridge at Remagen
15.description: As the Allied armies close in, the Germans decide to blow up the last Rhine bridge, trapping their own men on the wrong side. But will it happen?

16.name: Women in Love
16.description: Two best friends fall in love with a pair of women, but the relationships soon go in very different directions.

17.name: The Swimming Pool
17.description: Lovers Marianne and Jean-Paul spend their vacation in a villa on the French Riviera near St-Tropez. Marianne invites her former lover, Harry, and his teenage daughter to stay. Tension rises between them, especially when Jean-Paul seduces Penelope.

18.name: Kes
18.description: A young, English working-class boy spends his free time caring for and training his pet falcon.

19.name: They Shoot Horses, Don't They?
19.description: The lives of a disparate group of contestants intertwine in an inhumanely grueling dance marathon.

20.name: Z
20.description: Following the murder of a prominent leftist, an investigator tries to uncover the truth while government officials attempt to cover up their roles.

21.name: The Undefeated
21.description: After the Civil War, ex-Confederate soldiers heading for a new life in Mexico run into ex-Union cavalrymen selling horses to the Mexican government but they must join forces to fight off Mexican bandits and revolutionaries.

22.name: The Good Guys and the Bad Guys
22.description: An aging lawman and an aging outlaw join forces when their respective positions in society are usurped by a younger, but incompetent, Marshal, and a younger, but vicious, gang leader.

23.name: Age of Consent
23.description: An elderly artist thinks he has become too stale and is past his prime. His friend (and agent) persuades him to go to an off-shore island to try once more. On the island he rediscovers his ...                See full summary »

24.name: Mackenna's Gold
24.description: A bandit kidnaps a Marshal who has seen a map showing a gold vein on Indian lands, but other groups are looking for it too, while the Apache try to keep the secret location undisturbed.

25.name: Bob & Carol & Ted & Alice
25.description: A light-hearted picture of middle-aged love and friendship.

26.name: Cactus Flower
26.description: A dentist pretends to be married to avoid commitment, but when he falls for his girlfriend and proposes, he must recruit his lovelorn nurse to pose as his wife.

27.name: Guns of the Magnificent Seven
27.description: A Mexican revolutionary hires an American gunslinger to organize the rescue of their leader from a brutal Army prison.

28.name: The Rain People
28.description: When a housewife finds out she is pregnant, she runs out of town looking for freedom to reevaluate her life decisions.

29.name: The Damned
29.description: The dramatic collapse of a wealthy, industrialist/Junker family during the reign of the Third Reich.

30.name: The Passion of Anna
30.description: A recently divorced man meets an emotionally devastated widow and they begin a love affair.

31.name: Alice's Restaurant
31.description: A cinematic adaption of Arlo Guthrie's classic song story.

32.name: The Magic Christian
32.description: Sir Guy Grand, the richest man in the world, adopts a homeless boy, Youngman. Together, they set out to prove that anyone, and anything, can be bought with money.

33.name: Army of Shadows
33.description: An account of underground resistance fighters in Nazi-occupied France.

34.name: The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
34.description: A headstrong young teacher in a private school in 1930s Edinburgh ignores the curriculum and influences her impressionable 12 year old charges with her over-romanticized world view.

35.name: Topaz
35.description: A French Intelligence Agent becomes embroiled in the Cold War politics first with uncovering the events leading up to the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis, and then back to France to break up an international Russian spy ring.

36.name: The Laughing Woman
36.description: A rich and sadistic man, who enjoys degrading women as part of elaborate S&M games, abducts a female journalist. She is subjected to his unpleasant games but soon begins subverting him.

37.name: 100 Rifles
37.description: In 1912 Sonora, Mexico, native revolutionary Yaqui Joe robs a bank to buy arms for his oppressed people, but finds himself sought by an American lawman and the Mexican Army.

38.name: The Color of Pomegranates
38.description: A super-stylized, surreal biography of Armenian troubadour Sayat Nova, whose life is depicted through non-narrative amalgamations of poetic images.

39.name: The Gay Deceivers
39.description: Danny and Elliot avoid military service by pretending to be gay, but they have to act the part when the recruiting officer doesn't buy it.

40.name: Pippi Longstocking
40.description: Pippi Longstocking, a super-strong redheaded little girl, moves into her father's cottage Villa Villekulla, and has adventures with her next-door neighbors Tommy and Annika in this compilation film of the classic Swedish TV series.

41.name: The Wrecking Crew
41.description: The count has stolen enough gold to cause a financial crisis in the world markets so I.C.E. sends in ace spy Matt Helm to stop him. As Matt works alone, the British send in Freya to aid ...                See full summary »

42.name: Anne of the Thousand Days
42.description: Henry VIII of England discards one wife, Catharine of Aragon, who has failed to produce a male heir, in favor of the young and beautiful Anne Boleyn.

43.name: The Milky Way
43.description: Two drifters go on a pilgrimage from France to Santiago de Compostela in Spain. Along the way, they hitchhike, beg for food, and face the Christian dogmas and heresies from different Ages.

44.name: The Computer Wore Tennis Shoes
44.description: At Medfield College, an accident with a donated computer gives Dexter Riley the ability to remember any knowledge learned instantly and perfectly.

45.name: Marooned
45.description: Three American astronauts are stranded in space when their retros won't fire. Can they be rescued before their oxygen runs out?

46.name: The Sterile Cuckoo
46.description: Two students from neighboring colleges in upstate New York are swept up in a tragic romantic interlude calling for a maturity of vision beyond their experience of capabilities. Pookie Adams...                See full summary »

47.name: Marlowe
47.description: A young woman from Kansas hires LA private detective Philip Marlowe to find her missing brother.

48.name: The Love Factor
48.description: A race of topless, large-breasted women from the planet Angvia, in another dimension, come to earth to kidnap women to repopulate their planet.

49.name: My Night at Maud's
49.description: The rigid principles of a devout Catholic man are challenged during a one-night stay with Maud, a divorced woman with an outsize personality.

50.name: The Battle of Neretva
50.description: World war two drama about the 1943 battle around the Neretva River between Axis forces and Yugoslav partisan units.
